recommendations.recommendation:
On the whole it was a lot of fun. It is a kids show and there are times that really shows but the plot is actualy consistant through the series and better put together than a lot of normal anime I have watched.
The way it ended left an opeing for a season 2, if there is one I plan to watch it.
Steve

anime.description: The series stars Yuta Akigawa, an elementary school boy who lives in a city run entirely by computers. One day, he opens a phone email message that sucks him inside his mobile phone and into "net space." There he meets three mysterious creatures named Pit, Pot, Pat — PiPoPa for short. The four go on adventures between both the human world and the net world.

tag.name: robot helper
tag.description: In a http://anidb.net/t2846 [science fiction] setting, the robot helper is, in a comedic sense, pretty much equivalent to what the "cute comic relief http://anidb.net/t1835 [animal sidekick]" is in a fantasy setting. The usually small machine has artificial intelligence, enabling it to support their owner / master with advice or help with menial tasks. http://anidb.net/t1278 [Androids] should not be considered robot helpers since these are far more complex; use the android tag instead.

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: elementary school
tag.description: The term elementary school is used in some countries for schools where children from the age of about five receive primary education.

tag.name: magic
tag.description: Magic is the art of purportedly manipulating aspects of reality either by supernatural means or through knowledge of unknown occult laws.

tag.name: robot
tag.description: A robot is an automatically guided machine, able to do tasks on its own. Another common characteristic is that by its appearance or movements, a robot often conveys a sense that it has intent or agency of its own. Not to be confused with android (human-like robot).

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: future
tag.description: Anime that fall under the future category are the ones that have a society that could have originated from ours. In most cases it should go hand to hand with sci-fi since we expect the future to consist of advanced technology, however, in the case where it`s explicitly stated in the story that the anime takes place "x years into the future", the state of technology doesn`t matter as long as it`s long into the future. The anime can be set in an alternative universe not tied with our own, as long as it has a futuristic feel to it. This category sports quite a lot of anime, mostly stemming from SciFi, but not necessarily only from there.

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: proxy battles
tag.description: In our terms, a proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode. Often the training aspect is also involved, or in some cases the proxies are nothing more than holographic representatives of some other variation of competition (like for example a card game). While many popular shounen anime fit under this category, it`s not limited to shounen anime.

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: coming of age
tag.description: In the strict sense the Coming of age describes a young person`s transition from adolescence to adulthood. In anime the term is used in a more general sense where the protagonists have to face a challenge, make an important decision in their life, take on responsibility, or learn a lesson, and by overcoming these obstacles they reach a higher level of maturity.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: ヨウコソ@ネットセカイヘ
Welcome @ Net World
Youkoso Net Sekai e
episode.summary: An ordinary elementary school student, Yuta Akigawa was suddenly taken into the Web World through his cell phone. At that moment, he was met by the Web Ghosts. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カエリタイ@カエレナイ
Want to Go Home @ Can`t Go Home
Kaeritai Kaerenai
episode.summary: Yuta who was suddenly drawn into the Web World was invited by PiPoPa to wander around this world. When he first looked around at the scenes, he was astonished. However, no one knew how Yuta could return to his world… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ガッコウヘ@イコウ!?
Let`s Go to @ school!
Gakkou e Ikou!?
episode.summary: Today is Taro’s first day at the new school he transferred to but it’s such a high tech elementary school that he is totally bewildered by everything. Moreover, PiPoPa from the Web World are visiting his school’s website. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヒカル@プリン@オジイチャン
Hikaru @ Pudding @ Grandfather
Hikaru Purin Ojii-chan
episode.summary: Hikaru, who is interested in Yuta, invited him to her house. However, Hikaru’s grandfather is hard to please. He has a PhD… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ビボバ@サンジョウデゴザイマス
BiBoBa @ Appear!
Biboba Sanjou de Gozaimasu
episode.summary: PiPoPa’s eternal Web Ghosts rivals are BiBoBa. Today, they challenged PiPoPa to competitions. Yuta is also being challenged to competitions by his classmate Kazushige. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チャンネル@ウォーズ
Channel @ Wars
Channel Wars
episode.summary: Recently, Yuta and PiPoPa have slipped into the Net TV which has been the topic of conversation. They have gone around visiting various channels. However, a dreadful computer virus suddenly attacked! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: リョカン@ユキタニテイ
Inn @ Yukitani`s
Ryokan Yukitani-tei
episode.summary: Recently the classmate, Karin, has been depressed. Her family business of running an inn hasn’t had many customers and it seems they will go out of business. Yuta and Hikaru wanted to make a homepage for the inn to help market it but for some reason, Karin’s grandmother doesn’t like the internet… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ユウタ@カイシャホウモン
Yuuta @ Company Visit
Yuuta Kaisha Houmon
episode.summary: In order to study about the societal structure, Yuta will be visiting Dream Future. However, he goes astray at the company and ends up in the basement. What does he see there? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ハタラケ@アイザワ
Work @ Aizawa
Hatarake Aizawa
episode.summary: A young part-time worker, Aizawa, turned up in Kamimai city. However, Yuta and Hikaru are worried since Aizawa is quite clumsy. At that time, a suspicious event occurred in the shopping district. Who could it be? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: オペレーション@ピポパ
Operation @ PiPoPa
Operation Pipopa
episode.summary: Yuta is busy playing games with his friends when they hatch a secret plan. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マモルトユウタ@
Mamoru And Yuuta@
Mamoru to Yuuta
episode.summary: Today is Yuta’s birthday. Last year, he was able to celebrate with his good friend, Mamoru. Yuta asks PiPoPa if they can help him meet Mamoru through the Web World. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ネットサーファー@ユウタ
Net Surfer @ Yuuta
Net Surfer Yuuta
episode.summary: Dream Future staff member Mr. Kazama is busy working on a mysterious new project... The Siren Project. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヒカル@ネットダイブ
Hikaru @ Net Dive
Hikaru Net Dive
episode.summary: Hikaru follows Yuta into the closet where he suddenly disappears... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: タナバタ@バージョンアップ!?
Star Festival @ Version Up?!
Tanabata Version Up!?
episode.summary: The Star Festival is approaching and the gang has to think of wishes. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ネットゴースト@ダイシュウゴー!
Net Ghosts @ Large Gathering!
Net Ghost Daishuugou!
episode.summary: Pit, Pot and Pat call upon Yuta and Hikaru to help them in the Web World because they are "in trouble" Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヒカル@ヤクソク@ナツヤスミ
Hikaru @ Promise @ Summer Vacation
Hikaru Yakusoku Natsuyasumi
episode.summary: Hikaru reflects on spending some quality time at the beach with her family. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ダイスキ@ジュウサマ
I Love @ Juu-sama
Daisuki Juu-sama
episode.summary: Hikaru shows off her talent against Kazushige in a fighting game, beating him five times in a row! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マモル@
Mamoru @
Mamoru
episode.summary: Seeking inspiration, Mamoru reminisces about a time when he and Yuta were looking up at the stars Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カズシゲ@マナツノユメ
Kazushige @ Mid-Summer Dream
Kazushige Manatsu no Yume
episode.summary: Kazuhige becomes jealous when Hikaru wants to go to the festival with Yuta Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マイゴ@マイゴ@マイゴ
Lost @ Lost @ Lost
Maigo Maigo Maigo
episode.summary: A web ghost intervenes with the traffic jam Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: スイーパー@ヒカル
Sweeper @ Hikaru
Sweeper Hikaru
episode.summary: Hikaru and Pat are cleaning up garbage in the Web World. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: (カズシゲ+ビボバ)^2@
(Kazushige + BiBoBa)^2 @
(Kazushige to Biboba) ^2
episode.summary: Kazushige accidentally enters the Web World and thinks its a dream! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: プー@セイレーン
Puu @ Seiren
Puu Seiren
episode.summary: Someone wants to erase Pu! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: プー! @プー! @プー!
Puu! @ Puu! @ Puu!
Puu! Puu! Puu!
episode.summary: The Witch of the Web World reveals herself Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ピポパ@ピポパプー!
PiPoPa @ PiPoPaPuu!
Pipopa Pipopapuu!
episode.summary: Yuta, Pit, Pot and Pat embark on a dangerous journey. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: @ミンナダイスキ
@ I Like Everyone
Minna Daisuki
episode.summary: Mamoru dreams about going to the Web World as a promise he made to his grandfather. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ネットゴースト@ピポパプー?
Net Ghost @ PiPoPaPuu?
Net Ghost Pipopapuu?
episode.summary: Yuta`s friends in the Web World start to grow impatient. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: サヤカ@テンコウセイ
Sayaka @ Transfer Student
Sayaka Tenkousei
episode.summary: Dream Future gets a new president. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ナリタイ@ネットアイドル☆
Want To Be @ A Net Idol
Naritai Net Idol
episode.summary: The school looks to the most popular web idol, Eri Eri Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: スランプ@ポエム@ダイナゴン
Slump @ Poem @ Dynagon
Slump Poem Dynagon
episode.summary: Kazuhige becomes troubled by the two girls he likes, Hikaru and Sayaka. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ケイサン@パ@パット
Calculation @ Pa @ Pat
Keisan Pa Pat
episode.summary: The gang seeks advice from Professor Sofue about a mysterious transforming web ghost Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ホップ@スタンプ@レベルアップ
Hop @ Stamp @ Level Up
Hop Stamp Level Up
episode.summary: Professor Soufe begins to diagnose the virus that is infecting the Web World Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ギガ@パニック
Giga @ Panic
Giga Panic
episode.summary: As things turn back to normal in the Web World, the students in the real world are traveling by train Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: トラベル@トラブル@ラブラブ
Travel @ Trouble @ Love Love
Travel Trouble Love Love
episode.summary: The Pistachio meteor shower is happening... and it`s once every 12 years! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ワタシ@ワルクナイ
I Am @ Not Wrong
Watashi Warukunai
episode.summary: Hikaru`s grandfather has been hospitalized. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: @ネットヴィーナス
@ Net Venus
Net Venus
episode.summary: Sayaka has been Web Diving and Yuta suspects she is Web Venus. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マモル@ユウタ
Mamoru @ Yuuta
Mamoru Yuuta
episode.summary: Yuta and Hikaru go to meet Mamoru. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ユウタ@
Yuuta... @
Yuuta
episode.summary: Sayaka suspects that Mamoru is Divine Forest Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: プログラム@セイレーン
Program @ Seiren
Program Seiren
episode.summary: While in the Web World, Yuta, Pi, Po and Pa hear a strange singing voice that shakes the entire world. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ズット@イッショ
Together @ Forever
Zutto Issho
episode.summary: Siren is blocking connection to the Web World Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アエナイ... @アイタイ!
Can`t See You... @ Want To Meet You
Aenai... Aitai!
episode.summary: In the real world, life goes on but Yuta can`t stop thinking about his friends in the Web World. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: レジェンド@オリハルコン
Legend @ Orichalcum
Legend Orichalcum
episode.summary: Aizawa quits his job and reveals his true identity. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ネット@タンテイダン
Net @ Detectives
Net Tanteidan
episode.summary: Yuta, Hikaru and Kazuhige, with the help of their friends, embark on a mission to find something tiny. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ラビリンス@ディバイン
Labyrinth @ Divine
Labyrinth Divine
episode.summary: Imbued with so much power, Mamoru questions his existence in the Web World. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: バレンタインデー@ト♥
Valentine D@te
Valentine Date
episode.summary: Miss Eriko has a crush on Aizawa... and it turns out, he might just feel the same. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: フシギノクニノ@カリン
Karin @ What a Strange Country
Fushigi no Kuni no Karin
episode.summary: The Web Detectives take matters into their own hands. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: バブバブ@ピポパ
Babbling @ PiPoPa
Babubabu Pipopa
episode.summary: Miss Eriko tasks the class with learning and writing a report about babies. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: サイゴノ@カケラ
The Last @ Piece
Saigo no Kakera
episode.summary: In the Web World, a baseball game is underway! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: オトナタチ@コドモタチ
Adults @ Children
Otona-tachi Kodomo-tachi
episode.summary: Yuta, Hikaru and Kazuhige are invited by Aizawa to visit Dream Future. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: @スクエ!!
@ Save!!
Sukue!!
episode.summary: Yuta, drive by wanting to save Mamoru, decides to go into the Web World. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: キミト@ネットセカイヘ!
To the Net World @ With You!
Kimito Net Sekai e!
episode.summary: Yuta, Pit, Pot and Pat have one more obstacle to get through before they can rescue Mamoru Source: crunchyroll
